subject: Learning
title: Mozart Effect: Music Makes You Smarter?
description: A micro-lesson that makes Mozart Effect: Music Makes You Smarter? usable.

hook.text: In 1993, a study claimed listening to Mozart temporarily boosted spatial reasoning. Parents panicked.

buildup.text: Georgia gave every newborn a classical music CD. Florida mandated it in daycare.

discovery.text: The original effect was tiny, lasted only 10â€“15 minutes, and applied only to one narrow spatial task.

twist.text: Replication attempts mostly failed. Any temporary boost comes from arousal, not from Mozart specifically.

climax.text: Listening to any music you enjoy produces the same small arousal effect. Mozart isn't magic.

punchline.text: Music soothes the soul. It doesn't boost your IQ.

quiz.question: What did replication studies find about the Mozart Effect?
options: The effect mostly failed to replicate and was due to arousal, not Mozart
Listening to Mozart permanently raises IQ
Only Mozart's music has this effect
